subs.text: üìö Re-reading Taleb‚Äôs Fooled by Randomness for the first time since covid hit. From the preface, on intellectual immodesty. There is a direct line from this to the catastrophic early response to the pandemic. BTW, our company is called Cartesian but we are Montaignes at heart. [link]
subs.rawText:
üìö Re-reading Taleb‚Äôs Fooled by Randomness for the first time since covid hit. From the preface, on intellectual immodesty. There is a direct line from this to the catastrophic early response to the pandemic.

BTW, our company is called Cartesian but we are Montaignes at heart. https://t.co/suQppCwmwm

subs.text: Hyperprogression in 4 of 12 patients with PTCL treated with nivolumab (3 of those with AITL) [link] Fun fact: when we sent data on our 11 patients with TCL to same journal (JITC), sole reviewer‚Äôs one-line review was: too few patients! So, 12 is the magic number!
subs.rawText:
Hyperprogression in 4 of 12 patients with PTCL treated with nivolumab (3 of those with AITL) https://t.co/0wNEGJ93W3
Fun fact: when we sent data on our 11 patients with TCL to same journal (JITC), sole reviewer‚Äôs one-line review was: too few patients! So, 12 is the magic number!

subs.text: ‚ÄúWhether hot or cold water freezes faster remains unknown.‚Äù Thus begins a wonderful Quanta Magazine article about the ‚ÄúMpemba effect‚Äù, named after a Tanzanian teenager who saw something funny happen to his home-made ice cream. Reality is complicated. [link]
subs.rawText:

subs.text: June 9

PSA: don‚Äôt dig holes in the sand. A few years ago my wife and I finished a Thanksgiving beach outing by helping dig out a kid (not ours!) completely buried after a hole he was in collapsed. He made it out alive, but it was traumatic for everyone involved. [link]

subs.text: June 8

Residency programs‚Äô publication requirements generate the worst kind of scientific BS ‚Äî useless case reports and rushed chart reviews that clog lit searches without creating any meaningful insight, all while wasting residents‚Äô precious time. Please stop.

subs.text:
@rubinstein_md @ManniMD1 @MediHumdani Do you really think either of the K-M curves need to reach the median before doing any sort of OS analysis? ‚ÄúMedian OS is not reached‚Äù and ‚ÄúThere has been no difference in OS to date‚Äù are two mutually compatible statements.

I leave implications and interpretation to myeloma docs
subs.rawText:
@rubinstein_md @ManniMD1 @MediHumdani Do you really think either of the K-M curves need to reach the median before doing any sort of OS analysis? ‚ÄúMedian OS is not reached‚Äù and ‚ÄúThere has been no difference in OS to date‚Äù are two mutually compatible statements.

I leave implications and interpretation to myeloma docs

subs.text:
@EricTopol @NCIEytanRuppin 12, not 18.
In a tiny subset of patients with cancer.
Using a class of drug already known to work well in that subset.
It is great news that ICIs may be moved up before surgery and the investigators deserve kudos, but your tweet and the NYT article are needlessly sensationalistic
subs.rawText:
@EricTopol @NCIEytanRuppin 12, not 18.
In a tiny subset of patients with cancer.
Using a class of drug already known to work well in that subset.
It is great news that ICIs may be moved up before surgery and the investigators deserve kudos, but your tweet and the NYT article are needlessly sensationalistic
